content.question: Matrices <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B"><mi>B</mi></math> are <math alttext="2 by 2"><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>2</mn></math> matrices of real numbers. If <math alttext="A times B equals A"><mi>A</mi><mo>·</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi></math>, matrix <math alttext="B"><mi>B</mi></math> is equivalent to which of the following?

choices.label: <math alttext="A 2 by 2 matrix. Row 1 column 1 is 1. Row 1 column 2 is 0. Row 2 column 1 is 0. Row 2 column 2 is 1."><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="A 2 by 2 matrix. Row 1 column 1 is 1. Row 1 column 2 is 1. Row 2 column 1 is 1. Row 2 column 2 is 1."><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="A 2 by 2 matrix. Row 1 column 1 is 0. Row 1 column 2 is 1. Row 2 column 1 is 1. Row 2 column 2 is 0."><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="A 2 by 2 matrix. Row 1 column 1 is 1. Row 1 column 2 is 0. Row 2 column 1 is 1. Row 2 column 2 is 0."><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="A 2 by 2 matrix. Row 1 column 1 is 1. Row 1 column 2 is 0. Row 2 column 1 is 0. Row 2 column 2 is 1."><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

topic.text: 4.11: The Inverse and Determinant of a Matrix

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
